page.title: 12Birdwatching in Exford
page.content: All my family like birdwatching. For Domesday we thought that we would do a village birdwatch and describe some of the birds seen in an hour. First we walked by the river in Exford .We saw a grey wagtail catching flies. Then a blue tit in the trees.Some Mallards swimming in the river disturbed a dipper. Every time that we looked up we saw swallow,housemartin and swifts. In the Auction field we saw magpie, blackbird,crow,rook and jackdaw. A starling was feeding among the cows. On the Green there were pied wagtail, chaffinch,housesparrow and a herring gull.In the hedges flocks of goldfinch greenfinch were found.On the way home we saw the king of Exmoor birds the Buzzard. These are just a few of the birds found on Exmoor.
